climbs.name: Variations on a Theme
climbs.fa: Ted St. Peter Blair / Charlie Yarnell / Lucas Campbell / Jon Steitzer

content.description: A left facing corner that's slightly overhanging cracks and flakes with a lot of jugs. It all starts the same but as you get higher you have a few different choices for ending, with the choices getting harder from left to right. Really fun, but watch out for loose rock.
content.location: 2/3rds of the way down the upper section of the bouldering wall

content.description: On a nice very slightly overhanging oval face, some stuff to pinch leads to cool top out.
content.location: Halfway along the bouldering wall, at the end of the upper section by the scree hill.

content.description: An easy juggy ladder up to the top of the hill. Looks like a log with steps cut into it, set into a crack.
content.location: 30' in from the extreme right end of the bouldering wall.

content.description: Starts off straight forward with a crack you can sink some fingers into, but then requires moving left as the ground falls away making it a highball. Ends moving up into some serious lichen and moss.
content.location: Just left of Jacob's Ladder, about 35 feet end from the right side of the bouldering wall.

pathTokens: e. Penobscot Bay to Schoodic Point

content.description:
Bluff Head is a super secluded undeveloped place near the head of the Bagaduce River. There's great potential for a few boulder problems, and a few trad single pitch lines or possibly sport lines if someone wanted to bother to bolt it. 

  This place is remote, hard to get to, and short and dirty and kinda chossy when you arrive. But hey, it makes you forget that you're in the regiment for a bit so that's worth something right?  

  Extremely vegetated, with animals living in a burrow halfway up the face.

 It faces south west, and has mid day to afternoon sun, and looks over a beautiful scenic part of the Bagaduce River.

 _________ 

  for more local detail ask the staff of the climbing wall at Maine Maritime Academy, located in Castine.
